place.name: ROWBERROW
place.gazetteerText: ROWBERROW, a parish, with a village, in Axbridge district, Somerset; on the N W end of the Mendip hills, 3 miles N N E of Axbridge, and 5¼ S S E of Yatton r. station. Post-town, Congresbury, Somerset. Acres, 954. Rated property, £511. Pop., 241. Houses, 63. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to E. Leacroft, Esq. Lapis calaminaris is found, and has beenworked. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £134.* Patron, the Bishop of Worcester. The church is ancient, and was restored in 1865. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
